reviewText:
I love Primal Carnage. I played the original since release when I was 12, and I have loved it ever since. The concept is amazing, who doesn't like being a tyrannosaurus eating humans, and who doesn't like being a commando blowing raptors to bits. Extinction (now having been released for over a year now) has made a slight improvement over the old one. Better graphics, more content, bug fixes etc.

But, it has a long way to go.

The original has imo much better gameplay and actually more balanced teams, as I still play it and often win as humans. (Surprised?) The deathmatch system in the first one is much better, and is overall I'd say funner than the DM in the second one. I also like the fact (even though I am a skin collector) that no-one really cares for skins in the first one. You just load it, select a server and play. No faffing about skins, market or whining that you haven't got a feathered raptor.

That brings me on to the cons of the game. The community is lovely at most, I met some wonderful people on this game who genuinely play for the fun. However, there is that dark corner of the community that beg for skins, riddled with trollers and hackers. I do enjoy the addition of the loot system, though. The skins are remarkable, and do add that creative side to the game, with moddable features on its way. The multiple skins of the game bring pros and cons to the game.

Moving on to another con, the gameplay and the unbalance. The humans have a massive disadvantage to the dinosaurs. The shotgun for the pathfinder is way too weak, the dinosaurs don't take fall damage and the numerous amounts of tyrants each round make it hard to play as the humans. However, when you are winning as the humans, it beats the dinosaurs by a long way.
I also think they nerfed the rex too much. He is literally a walking free kill. His trample does not insta-kill (which I think it should, an 8 tonne animal steps on your head? You are going to die. (Do correct me on my accuracy of weight, too. xD) And if they do buff him back up, I'd also expect to see a similar tyrant limit to the first game. Apart from that problem, I think the dinosaurs are way over-powered and it takes a lot of skill and teamwork to win as a human.

Overall, I enjoy this game on a daily basis, from hanging out with friends to playing deathmatch, I definitely recommend it. But do not expect perfect gameplay, as there are still balance issues and some problems with the game that need addressing.

reviewText: Primal Carnage Extinction is a good game, I spend a lot of time playing it and the game mechanics work really well, it's not too complicated. reviewText:
I really wanted to like Primal Carnage: Extinction.

This game is broken and buggy as heck. None of the classes are fun to play, humans just get mowed over by dinosaurs especially since the human to dino ratio in an average server is 2:3. The guns are inaccurate, also hitboxes are completely broken so most bullets are not registering when they should be. Mind you it has been like this since the game came out. The raptor pounce has also been broken since release, and the devs keep claiming that they are constantly working on these issues. They need to stop making promises they can't keep.

90% of the servers are set to free roam. They are populated by either people idling to get drops or children who like to roleplay their fantasies of being a demon tyrannosaurus or the raptor squad from JW. The devs accomodate these people, mostly because they are milked like cows buying poorly made skins from the marketplace. I myself have left this game running for hours and hours and have managed to make some steam bucks by selling the cosmetics.

This game clearly has no idea which direction it is going in, and the developers are obviously incompetent. I am only scratching the surface of all the issues in this game, but I am not going to waste any more energy on it and uninstall. I closely followed Lukewarm media's original Primal Carnage since early alpha, and it meant a lot to me. This game is one of the biggest disappointments of my life.

reviewText:
Having reached 300 hours of total game time today and owning it for over a year I decided now would be a good time to wright a review.

Firstly, before you buy be aware that the game is currently leaving/recently left a dark tunnel it has been in for the past few months. What I mean by that is a for a while there were problems with the game such as low player counts and balancing issues. However, the devs are working hard (probably) and these problems are starting to go away (probably). So just be aware that there may be some bugs or balancing issues. So, now to the actual review.

The Dinosaurs

The dinosaurs in this game are actually suprisingly well modeled and animated for a non-AAA" game. The controls are fairly easy but some dinosaurs need more skill than others. There are a few issues like tyrants being killed very quickly but other than that they are incredibly enjoyable.

The Humans

The human team used to be underpowered
date:
but now they have the choice between a lot more guns some quite powerful (i'm looking at you SPAZ) so the humans at times can seem a little bit OP. I myself am terrible at playing as a human but perhaps many of you are a lot better than I am.

Market and cosmetics

One of the things about the devs is their love for adding skins. This can be good or bad. It's good because you see a variety of different characters on the field but is bad because in the dark ages it seemed to be the priority. Recently
recommended: a workshop was added where players can add their own skins and the ones with the most votes get added into the game
hoursPlayed:
meaning the devs can focus more on the actuall game.

Game Progress

While the devs used to take a while with many update delays
voteText: like I said they're coming out of the dark tunnel now and we are getting updates each month. It's because of this consistency that the playerbase has grown quite a bit. Now
helpfulPercent: there is a slight problem with that
votesHelpful:
which is the one thing trying it's best to keep PC:E in that tunnel and I think it needs an entire section for it...

FreeRoam servers over TDM

If you look at the server list if get the game
votesTotal: you may notice the ratio of FR to TDM servers is around 25:1
votesFunny: and the two TDM servers there are full. That is one of the main problems with the game and to boost it even more there was a recent update with a new Free Roam map (it's a cool map but 95% of servers are on it). To be honest though
commentsCount: it's not as bad as back in the dark ages. Roleplay dominated the Island of Primal Carnage
column16: and there was an uncontrollable amount of dirty dinos around every corner. But like I said that was back in the dark ages and I quite sure that doesn't happen anymore (well
column17: I haven't set foot on the MPCQ servers in a very long time so I can't be sure). You might hear while playing the game about Get to The Chopper (GTTC). This gamemode was fun but servers hosting it are practically non-existent now. But
column18:
a huge revamp of the gamemode is on it's way so you might see that in the near future.

Summary

Pros:
Dino gamplay is good
Scenery is nice
More frequent updates now
Balancing is ok
"Dark ages" have almost ended
New content on the way including gamemodes and dinosaurs

Cons:
Way to many freeroam servers
Tyrants are killed quickly
Some remanents of the dark ages are still here
Some members of the community are... well like most 11 year olds you see in gaming so it's really not that different to other games I suppose.

Overall

reviewText:
2016 Update: UDK is here!
Devs keep delivering content and working to improve gameplay, open testing and long-awaited features like mapvote and kickvote shows devs are looking foward to make PC:E a better experience.
Because of recent additions, including optimization patches and the hard work behind the release of the Primal Carnage Editor, once again i feel safe to recommend this game for people looking take part in some Dino vs Human action or contribute to make an even better game by creating their own custom content.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Old review:

Since my original review, PC:E has been receiving several updates which have improved the game over some of my old complaints, Movement and combat, while still not on par with Original PC, has been worked to the point it´s actually enjoyable to play the game instead of the chore that controlling the classes used to be. Game balance has been improved as well, now giving humans a chance to actually beat the dinosaur team if the classes and weapons are properly used.

While some of my old complaints remain, mostly on the in-game market and the way it turns skins and cosmetics into highly overpriced items, PC:E developers have shown they are looking foward to keep improving and expanding on the game, a new, promising, Survival" gamemode has been added as well new weapons
date: a new dinosaur class and maps
recommended: all these free of any extra charge.\n\nAfter months of being skeptical
hoursPlayed: i can finally see some progress on the game being made and potential for it become even better

reviewText:
Early Access Review

NOTE: This Review is going to be updated on upcoming Updates
It is really good game, there's not much you can do as now but its fun to play, loved it, graphics are really good, especially when raining, there are bugs and glitches i'll edit review on later date for that, and as my main point i'd like to put suggestions as what we need to see in the future.

Suggestions:
- 3D Loadout where we can rotate characters while equipping.
- Seasonal Events with its own exclusive items.
- Steam Marketplace, we should be able to buy/sell items of our inventory since this game has it enabled but you don't have any of the items on steam inventory.
- Brand New Survival Mode that'll take longer to finish.
- Balance, not just at the characters but also at the players, we should have balances based on Stats.
- Stats (K/D as Human, K/D as Dino, K/D as Character and K/D overall, how long have i walked or played with character etc.)

reviewText:
I came into this game unsure of how it would turn out because I was reading so many mixed reviews. I don't regret buying it. It's an awesome game and I think it deserves a little more attention. It's true there are some issues with it, but it's a new game and they could (and hopefully will) address any problems. I particularly enjoy the new game mode, Dino deathmatch, because I feel it evens out the odds a little. I find that the humans in this game (and the first one) are underpowered compared to their Dino enemies and it takes the fun out of playing when you are dying every time you so much as take a step anywhere alone. Unfortunately the Dino deathmatch servers end up empty fairly quickly.. Anyway it's a fun game and worth getting, especially while it's on sale.

The movements feel fluid to me, despite what I've been told. The environments are beautiful as well. I've heard people complaining that it is buggy to all hell, but the only bugs I've encountered are:
-Carnos have been freezing it seems. I've seen a few players (every now and again, not constantly) be unable to move suddenly as a carno.
-When hit by certain things ptera/tupa gets glitched to some random part of the map and/or gets a really weird speed boost.
-(This is one I've experienced, I don't know if it's a common problem) SUPPOSEDLY the different numbered crates give out different things if you buy a key for it. I recieved a Crate #3" which apparently turned into just "Dinosaur crate" like the one I had sitting in my Inv which was disappointing concidering I bought a key just to open that one :\n
Otherwise I'd give it... 8-9/10 at least for what it is right now."

reviewText:
This is the best Jurassic Park game we never got (seriously, WTF Universal Studios -_-). This is a PVP multiplayer game, where one team play as human hunters, while the other team play as MOTHER♥♥♥♥ING DINOSAURS :D. It has fun as hell gameplay, great controlls, great selection of various dinosaur species (like Spinosaurus and Tyrannosaurus Rex).

The only issues are that the balance between the two teams are sometimes awful (where the dinosaur team completly dominates the human team (which happens almost to me all the time when I am playing the game), and that the shotgun class in the human team is most times more effective then other classes (meaning that the other classes are mostly usless compered to the shotgun class) .

If you want a great dinosaur game, buy this game (or the previous Primal Carnage game or Dino D-day which I have not played either of those two games yet, just don`t buy the TellTale Jurassic Park game over this. If you do, you are a ♥♥♥♥ing idiot -_-).

I would give this game a 9.2/10 if there was a rating system for Steam reviews (Please give us a rating system for Steam reviews Valve).

reviewText:
Where do I even begin with this game?

I've put more time into this game than any other game I own on steam, which suprised me when my incentive to make an account was to play TF2, yet I now have more than double the hours in Primal Carnage Extinction than I do in TF2. People probably think I'd be somewhat insane to put that much time into a game like this, but lemme say what I gotta say about it first.

So here are a few of the things in this game that greatly appealed to me

One of the most interesting things about this game is that it is one of the few dinosaur games out there where you can play as a dinosaur against other humans. I only know of 2-3 other games that share this function, making it a standout in the genre

The graphics for this game are absolutel BEAUTIFUL. A lot of the maps and models have a very realistic feel to them, even if it is exaggurated to some extent.

There are many very nice skins in this game. A number of which I've been collecting. Ranging from raptors with quills and feathers to tupas with larger crests.

The skins are usually cheap. Now I'm guessing you're gonna see the market and complain about skins being up for $200 dollars and whine about it being expensive, but how many of the people who see those prices know how much certain skins in games like CSGO can go for? Tens of thousands of dollars in some cases...

Theres many other positives for this game, and overall, I would reccomend it to anyone looking for a competitive or casual shooter, any dinosaur lover, anyone looking to invest in the economy, and anyone looking for a fun game.

reviewText:
Im gonna rewrite this review because it got deleted somehow hmmmmmmmmm. Ok now let's start off with the basics this game is just plain awful. Let's make the dots that we ALL love so much.

1. Awful Fps almost on any server you go on even if you have an amazing computer it will lag regardless no questions asked  mainly because they didn't think through how the foliage and trees and certain gun fire would work they just plopped it in and left it.
2. Too expensive for what it offers ok so let's get off to a really known and annoying subject for players Little to none content. Whenever you want to play a match 80 percent of them are empty and the ones that actually have people in them are roleplay servers and basictesting that's what i see on a regular basis if you find an actual gamer server with people in it it's not gonna be alot it's also rare! This is really annoying for gamers that don't have too much time on there hands as i don't feel like playing servers with nothing in it and admins destroying everything (basictesting) i also don't feel like going on a server where players are starting familys with dinos... (Roleplay) Now im going to say this before people find this and start yelling at me i do not dislike roleplay i just think it's really dumb that those are pretty much the only populated servers.
3. Greedy game developers they made this game 13 more dollars than the original primal carnage for basically nothing. Your spending 13 more dollars of your money for this piece of crap and getting little to any content when you can just go and buy primal carnage which is actually better. The loot system is also really poor as it doesn't have a very smart concept and all you get are boxes yea? It's really rare to get any skins at all so if you want to look good you have to either buy keys or go to the market which is really crappy i don't ever spend money on in-game items if i do it's rare because i think it's a crap concept the only type of in-game item i can see myself buying is diamonds or something like that i'd rather earn my loot. Back to the key system even when you force yourself to buy keys and open the boxes it's so rare to get anything nice as i normally just see people get ugly blues which is depressing at least in most games opening boxes can earn you some profit. Obvious greed of the developers.
4. I've seen quite a few people mention this and i know it too this game was in development for quite a while they had enough time to make this game Dinosaur game of the world but instead they barthed out this 90 percent of the maps i can find bugs and glitches and missing items also did i mention that half of the maps even if they were finished would be ugly anyways most people will disagree with me on this but im telling you these maps are just plain bad we expected to see epic graphics 10/10 matches awesome content and maps that looked like they came from 2030 (just an expression) Im sure many people were hyped by this and are know cringing at the sound of it.
5. The one concept in this game that is actually good is profit making if your a lucky guy and are getting all the legendarys you can earn a pretty penny buy selling the skins and may earn yourself a couple better games.
6. Complete unbalancement if you find yourself in a good old deathmatch with a fair amoutn of people and you think you've finnally found the perfect server heh-heh-heh well good luck actually getting anywhere everytime you play as a carnivore humans will shoot at you then jump in the water or hid in tiniest of crevices now most people will say but it's the only way i won't get eaten which is true but it should not be. What's the point of a shooter if all your doing is hiding? one tactic that drives me insane as a raptor are sucicide bombers these players have no choice there just flat out terrible gamers. As a carnivore you are much too overpowerd than humans which is the main reason humans always hide they make it so you can nearly never be hit as a small dino and give the tyrants too much of a upper advantage against the humans sure with enough firepower you can slaughter them but if you got someone who is extremly skilled as a tyrant you've already won the game.

In conclusion there are just too many things wrong with this game for it to be fun or at all good after the time they were given and the time they still had to fix the game all they did was continue making more skins and BOXES!

I picked this up in the sale at 70% off and it still isn't worth it. As a fan of the original game I find this insulting.

An ingame shop with overpriced items such as player skins and keys which allow you to unlock the ingame items you pickup while paying. This wouldn't normally be an issue if items in game didn't cost hundreds in real life money to buy.

Admins join in on the few deathmatch servers available with indestructibility and the ability to drop unlimited grenades while playing as a dinosaur.  The majority of servers are roleplaying kids and the community is cancerous, they will attack you if you call an admin out on cheating in game.

The game is also very buggy and the developers seem lazy. Do not buy this game.

reviewText:
I'm gonna keep this short, since I hate writing essays on games.

So yeah.. My time playing this game. I went through a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ roleplay phase. Let's not talk about that... Ever...

Now I mainly play the game because it has nice dinosaur models to look at and There are quite a few. And mess with people as usual. However that does not make this game good. The animations are so slow and lazy, along with the gameplay that is lackluster and far from balanced.

The original Primal Carnage is better than this in so many ways. The feeling of weakness as a human was great. We had to group together and try to survive as raptors and pteras dogged us the whole way. I can't understand what the developers had in mind when they made this. The original was very balanced.

Along with all that, Their additions of New" dinosaurs are just reskins of others. With SLIGHTLY different abilitys. The most creative they got was with Acrocanthosaurus
date:
it has a nice skin and has deviated from the other tyrant classes. Faster with less health and AOE.

My final verdict is 6/10 due to the bad animations and the lazy addition of dinosaurs.

Edit: I feel that 7.5/10 is a better rating
recommended: since it is still relatively fun to play
hoursPlayed: and I usually find myself playing it."

reviewText:
This is a good game... I've spent too much time on it... Great game for any dinosaur-fan!
But......

Pros:
-Skins, so no dinosaur is the same.
-More dinos then other Primal Carnage Game
-Fun games (If you can find one)
-Dinosaurs! (Must I need to say more?)

Notes:
-Good maps
-Okay graphics
-Does not need a perfect computer to run game well
-Freeroam/RP: Yes, I like to RP occasionally, but to actually find decent people... Different Story.
-Still fun to run around as a dino
-Okay communtiy (There are so many different kinds of people in this game, I cannot pick a side directly)


Cons:
-Skins: (Yeah I know I noted this as a Pro) Accoring to everyone in the community, ever, the better skin you have, then the more people should like you and respect you. Wtf?
-Skins part 2: Shure the skins in this game are really nice, but to get a nice one, you have to spend about......... $400+ on it.
-Horrible human gameplay: the humans have been incredibly nerfed and you might as well be throwing rocks at the dinos.

So, if you enjoy just being a dinosaur, worshipping the player with the best skin, RPing (Sort of), or eating humans because they are pretty much always your dinner, this game COULD be for you.

reviewText:
This is seriously an AMAZING GAME! it has that jarrasic park feeling to it that I haven't felt as much in any other dino game. Although, this game does have a few flaws at launch..
1.) No voice chat yet.. there will be voice chat in the future since there is a push to talk option in the key bindings, but voice chat itself hasn't been added to the game at the time of writing this review.
2.) It is freaking HARD to use a teradactal (the flying dino).. Its a cool idea.. but with the low health and the grab box for lifting humans in the air.. just doesn't work so well.
3.) The reload time for the trapper human is insanely too long.. if you miss... you're fkd and its super easy to miss when dinos are running past you at super fast speeds.
And those are really the only flaws I can come up with, Which really are not even that bad,, but are bad enough for me to complain about..
I reccomend you buy this game, I feel like it will become a big game! And it's super fun to play with friends (:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When considering buying this game, it is important to remember that it is not only in Early Access, it only just started a few days before I wrote this review. There are bugs, some of them bad, but they will be fixed. My main problem at the time of this writing is balance. A game built around dinosaurs and humans should be hard to balance, but the previous Primal Carnage actually pulled it off and made a pretty balanced experience. This game, on the other hand, is not so. Fixed limits of tyrant class dinosaurs (the Tyrannosaurus and Spinosaurus) mean you can get the maximum 3 in a game when there are only three on each team, and tyrants can be a tough to kill if there is only one human per tyrant. The game's raptors are under-powered, while the Pterasaurs are rediculously overpowered. Many human weapons are underpowered and don't do the damage they should. On to non-balance problems, the big thing is match stability and fairness. First, matches will sometimes just randomly end in the middle, which can be quite annoying. Second, you choose your team at the beginning of every match of team-death-match, meaning that if you have a slower connection than others or are just slower to click, you can be stuck on the less-popular human team for many matches to come.

The thing is though, this is Early Access and the devs care and listen to players, so these problems should all be fixed relatively soon.

Overall, it is a fun game if you can stay in a match and alive long enough to really play. Right now, I would rate it 6/10. However, once they fix the aforementioned balance and stability issues, I would easily rate the game higher, and even more so when they begin releasing new maps, dinosaurs, skins, and weapons.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll keep it short.

- Graphics: Unreal 3 Engine, looks beatiful. Animations are nice, could use a tiny bit more work.
- Sound: Decent. Roooar! *T-REX*
- Gameplay: A bit buggy, glitchy and laggy sometimes, needs some balancing, but extremly fun.
- Support: Seems good, active and rapid development.
- Wishlist: Native Linux support, more maps, dinos, weapons, game modes and last but not least; some vehicles would be nice too.

Runs fine on Linux via vanilla Wine & Crossover. See here for more information: http://steamcommunity.com/app/321360/discussions/0/624076851154761778/

Verdict: I like dinosaur games, I love the Jurassic Park series (looking forward to Jurassic World). This game is fun, but it also has a lot of unused potential, which could be worked on to improve even further. Highly recommended to dino-fans, recommended for everyone else. Tip: Buy the original Primal Carnage, get Extinction on 50% discount afterwards (deal ends on 28th of Feb. 2015)! Two games for the price of one.

PS: Be sure to check out what the devs are working on and what they have planned for us here: https://trello.com/b/dqOgPeuk/extinction-roadmap

reviewText:
*Update* Community is just getting worse. The updates are not helping. As I stated before, it needs to be more focused on gameplay additions and fixes as well as pushing for final release of the game. Also it needs to be adding an actual timed leave penalty because someone didn't get the Dino team for a round even though the next round you're guaranteed the Dino team. Adding a time penalty before joining another server or rejoining will greatly reduce the dino hog issues and people leaving the server because they didn't get what they wanted. Yes this is proven to work. Just look at Guild Wars 2 dishonor system as an example which greatly fixed the player leaving problem.

Also the RP servers.....finally went into one. Never going back in. Special snowflakes everywhere. I RP in Guild Wars 2, and what I see in an RP server on this game was utterly disgraceful.

Also the game needs proper server distribution of population and less free roam BS. Seriously make the server setup much like Left 4 Dead 2. If they want to play TDM, have an algorithm will pick for them. This will consolidate players better so gameplay actually happens rather than 90% RP and Freeroam. If a player wants to RP or Freeroam, they can host their own server.

I'm not even gonna go into the economic system now...

I'm a diehard dinosaur lover and this game just make me further dissapointed. :/ I can't get behind it. Wonderful idea of a game, poorly executed now.

********************************************************************

Very awesome shooter. There really isn't anything like this game besides Team Fortress 2 and even then. It's a very original idea that should be supported and encouraged to continue. If I need to relax on a game, I head to this one over any other game.

The down side is that it does have massive bugs still, even with its (finally) beta release. It's worth the price, but they really should focus on balance and bugs rather than the economic system or skins right now. Crack down on those gameplay problems first before adding a large amount of features to the game. That'll retain players far more than just offering content.

The community is getting better, but there needs to be a better overhead on staff management of the game rather than community management. People aren't really trained to handle problems with others unless they have prior CSR experience. A good reporting system would be nice.

Another thing is to encourage more of the Team Deathmatch and Get to the Chopper games. Everything is all about Free Roam and Roleplay right now. As fun as those can be, it loses the fundamental part of what the game is and is advertised. It's dissapointing to try and find a decent TDM server that is not Contingency or Docks and usually see none.

But balancing needs to happen a little more, such as the pteradons need balancing alot, the stamina makes it so when the fly you can't hit them and with expirienced players doing this the game can get a little unfair. Other than that the balancing is fine.

reviewText:
Redoing my review for the 3rd time now after playing the latest version of the game. Keep in mind I have 300+ hours on the original game and 80 on this one. Love the developers behind the game and the community that plays it, etc.

Here's why PCE is better than the original PC:
- Still has developers devoted to it.
- Loadouts, DLC, gamemodes, and a new class.
- Plenty of class and weapon choices.
- It has an economy made up of skins and hats.

Here's why it ain't:
- Controls feel like PC did a metric ton of meth.
- Seriously, the controls are worse than if I tried playing PC blindfolded, drunk, and hung upside down.
- Some of the new mechanics I mentioned earlier don't make much a difference.
- The diverse choices of classes and weapons are either fairly similar to one another or just lazily made.
- Economy is a very bloated feature. There's plenty of it, but only a few good items belong in it. Not to mention humans get little-to-no-attention in DLC. DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME IF YOUR MAINLY INTERESTED IN THE ECONOMY. Seriously, there's a big, big chance you'll be disappointed with what you don't get.
- Servers aren't the best if you are out of the states/europe. Anywhere else in the world and your kinda burdened with lag.
- While the map design is eye-candy in this game, they really aren't balanced.
- Since release, the biggest content update is ANOTHER new Tyrant and a single gamemode containing only one map. The gamemode is fun for a while but does get repetitive and pointless after the first few minutes of playing it.
- There's only going to be one more big update for a VERY long time as the developers are going to halt any development on the game to work on PS4 port.
- Again, the controls. They're cringeworthy bad on the dinosaurs. A freaking human can circle-strife a raptor. Dilophosaurs can just barely sprint to catch a human.
- Human hit-detection is pretty poor. Aiming feels sluggish.
- The animations for humans and any other animations that aren't featured in the original game are pretty bad. The only good animations are recycled from an animator who has left the team.


I really tried to like this game and I'm going to keep on trying because the majority seem to find this game good. I want to think the game is good since I did love the original and the devs who are making this game. Maybe I'm missing something but this game is probably one of the worst I own in my library.

As of 7/28/15, I suggest you don't buy this.

reviewText:
Primal carnage extinction is a great sequal to primal carnage pushing high expectations for the new game primal carnage genesis although this game has many great qualities.It does have quite a few issues that lukewarm media need to adress such as the autobalance. The autobalance in this game needs to be better or the team system goes back to the way it used to be because you have people that just sit at the team screen spamming dinosaur and never playing humans this caues fair players who actually play humans to rarely be able to play dinosaur because the human team has little to no players.

There are some bugs in this game especially with the pouncing. There have been instances where i have pounced on a human and its all going well but somehow the game says he shot me and that im dead. Another one is when you pounce on a traper there is a chance that you will get netted and the pounce will fail or you'll continue the pounce but once finished you will be stuck there netted.

If you can fix these faults you will have a good game but to make it great Lukewarm media will have to make a system in the game like leveling or something because the amount of players playing the game rises high at the release but after that it quickly drops soon losing all players.

With these faults the game is buggy but you will get occasional games that are very fun and because of these games i do recommend this game, especially to the people that are only in it for the dinosaurs, the dinosaurs are amazing!

reviewText:
I really like this game, and there is really only ONE reason I suggest people should play this...

DINOSAURS!!!

It's a fun little concept and the fact that at least some of this game, if not most, has inspiration from Jurassic Park really sets off nostalgia and can probably be a very fun game if you know what you're doing.

Even if you don't, it's great to learn what you CAN do, and when you do, you can hit the top of the leaderboard in no time.

There are fast paced modes like TDM, GTTC, and Survival for those who want action in their experience, and for those who want to have a slower pace and just relax and have fun, there's always Free Roam.

If I were to recommend PC or PCE to beginners, I might have to go with PCE since the in-game tips are very helpful, but if you feel the original's a good start, then don't let me stop you.

If you don't particularly like this game, then that's your opinion, and i respect that, but please, PLEASE do not just download this game just so you can leave a nasty review, because some people find some things fun, while others think other things are fun instead...

Everyone has their own opinion, and everyone else needs to respect their opinions, and not put them down by saying they're 10 year old dinguses" or stuff like that.

reviewText: At first this game might just seem like a remake of primal carnage with a subtitle and some new skins, but dig deeper and you will find it has many new features and improvements over the original. One of the biggest changes is that humans now have a secondary gun option and have items which they can throw, which can help teamates or hurt dinos. The introduction of the acrocanthosaurus is something great that the original never had or is going to (probably), and is not just a different looking tyrant that does the exact same thing, all three tyrants have ups and downs. The spino has the most health but is the slowest, the t-rex is slightly faster than spino but has a bit less health, and the acro is the fastest but has the least health. There is also a new mode similar to call of dutys zombie mode, but with dinosaurs! It is called survival, and like its name suggests, you have to survive against many waves of dinosaurs, 20 to be exact. Wave 5 and 15 are specials waves, so far being a compy wave and hunter raptor waves. Wave 10 and 20 are boss waves, so far being a alpha novaraptor and acrocanthosaurus. There is only one map so far but more will be added in future, as well as more bosses. There are also a few new maps, and while I still think the original maps are best, they are nice additions to the game. The only problem i have with this game is that a lot of servers are roleplay servers, but there are still a good amount of team deathmatch and survival servers, but hardly any get to the chopper servers, which is a shame. Another problem i have with this game is that it has slightly worse optimization than the original, which is odd considering this had more time to improve its optimization, so people who could not run the original primal carnage very well will have even more trouble running this game, but im sure the devs will sort it out. So in conclusion if you were a fan of the original or just a dino fan in general, I would definitely reccomend this game :)\n\nEdit: Since the November 15th update optimization of this game has been improved dramatically, so even if you dont have a great pc or laptop, it should run just fine now. They have also added many new and interesting features to the game, which you can view on the community page

reviewText:
Redoing my review for the 3rd time now after playing the latest version of the game. Keep in mind I have 300+ hours on the original game and 80 on this one. Love the developers behind the game and the community that plays it, etc.

Here's why PCE is better than the original PC:
- Still has developers devoted to it.
- Loadouts, DLC, gamemodes, and a new class.
- Plenty of class and weapon choices.
- It has an economy made up of skins and hats.

Here's why it ain't:
- Controls feel like PC did a metric ton of meth.
- Seriously, the controls are worse than if I tried playing PC blindfolded, drunk, and hung upside down.
- Some of the new mechanics I mentioned earlier don't make much a difference.
- The diverse choices of classes and weapons are either fairly similar to one another or just lazily made.
- Economy is a very bloated feature. There's plenty of it, but only a few good items belong in it. Not to mention humans get little-to-no-attention in DLC. DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME IF YOUR MAINLY INTERESTED IN THE ECONOMY. Seriously, there's a big, big chance you'll be disappointed with what you don't get.
- Servers aren't the best if you are out of the states/europe. Anywhere else in the world and your kinda burdened with lag.
- While the map design is eye-candy in this game, they really aren't balanced.
- Since release, the biggest content update is ANOTHER new Tyrant and a single gamemode containing only one map. The gamemode is fun for a while but does get repetitive and pointless after the first few minutes of playing it.
- There's only going to be one more big update for a VERY long time as the developers are going to halt any development on the game to work on PS4 port.
- Again, the controls. They're cringeworthy bad on the dinosaurs. A freaking human can circle-strife a raptor. Dilophosaurs can just barely sprint to catch a human.
- Human hit-detection is pretty poor. Aiming feels sluggish.
- The animations for humans and any other animations that aren't featured in the original game are pretty bad. The only good animations are recycled from an animator who has left the team.


I really tried to like this game and I'm going to keep on trying because the majority seem to find this game good. I want to think the game is good since I did love the original and the devs who are making this game. Maybe I'm missing something but this game is probably one of the worst I own in my library.

As of 7/28/15, I suggest you don't buy this.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
*Update* Community is just getting worse. The updates are not helping. As I stated before, it needs to be more focused on gameplay additions and fixes as well as pushing for final release of the game. Also it needs to be adding an actual timed leave penalty because someone didn't get the Dino team for a round even though the next round you're guaranteed the Dino team. Adding a time penalty before joining another server or rejoining will greatly reduce the dino hog issues and people leaving the server because they didn't get what they wanted. Yes this is proven to work. Just look at Guild Wars 2 dishonor system as an example which greatly fixed the player leaving problem.

Also the RP servers.....finally went into one. Never going back in. Special snowflakes everywhere. I RP in Guild Wars 2, and what I see in an RP server on this game was utterly disgraceful.

Also the game needs proper server distribution of population and less free roam BS. Seriously make the server setup much like Left 4 Dead 2. If they want to play TDM, have an algorithm will pick for them. This will consolidate players better so gameplay actually happens rather than 90% RP and Freeroam. If a player wants to RP or Freeroam, they can host their own server.

I'm not even gonna go into the economic system now...

I'm a diehard dinosaur lover and this game just make me further dissapointed. :/ I can't get behind it. Wonderful idea of a game, poorly executed now.

********************************************************************

Very awesome shooter. There really isn't anything like this game besides Team Fortress 2 and even then. It's a very original idea that should be supported and encouraged to continue. If I need to relax on a game, I head to this one over any other game.

The down side is that it does have massive bugs still, even with its (finally) beta release. It's worth the price, but they really should focus on balance and bugs rather than the economic system or skins right now. Crack down on those gameplay problems first before adding a large amount of features to the game. That'll retain players far more than just offering content.

The community is getting better, but there needs to be a better overhead on staff management of the game rather than community management. People aren't really trained to handle problems with others unless they have prior CSR experience. A good reporting system would be nice.

Another thing is to encourage more of the Team Deathmatch and Get to the Chopper games. Everything is all about Free Roam and Roleplay right now. As fun as those can be, it loses the fundamental part of what the game is and is advertised. It's dissapointing to try and find a decent TDM server that is not Contingency or Docks and usually see none.

reviewText:
At the moment, I can't recommend this game. I know this game will get better, the developers are trying as hard as they can and I respect that. I will change my review once the problems are adressed.

PROS:
-Very visually pleasing, good graphics.
-Nice variety of skins/workshop.
-Maps are well made and overall very aesthetically pleasing.
-Fun gameplay as both humans and dinosaurs.
-Great developers who try their best to help the community.

CONS:
-The lack of TDM servers (Team deathmatch)
-Overwhelming amounts of Free Roam/Role play servers.
-Some of the maps seem to be unbalanced towards teams. Dinosaur/human advantages.
-Loot and skins. I love the skins personally, but they're way too expensive on the market. (Up to 100$ USD)
-Unbalanced classes.
One of the greatest things that I have a problem with is the repetitiveness. TDM is fun, but there's only about 2-5 of those open and the rest are free roam. I want to play hunt, gttc, or many other great gamemodes but usually there''s never any servers like that open or with people playing them.

Overall: This game is great but also has it's downsides which weighs more than the pros. I still have high hopes.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Access at this point, and a work in progress it is indeed. Glitches to go around and balance issues out the wazoo.

HOWEVER, what it does right should also be considered; The Devs are very attentive, patches are plentyful, the community's (mostly) excellent, and almost everything that made the first game amazing is back and better. The few bits that aren't, will be in due time. Especially if they continue their current rythm.

In my opinion, it boils down to this; If you're alright with Early Access games, get it. If it's on sale, get it. If you owned the original and have the discount, get it. Otherwise, may want to hold on just a wee bit longer.

reviewText: When I started to play Primal Carnage: Extinction I wasn't sure what to expect. Let's be honest - it's hard to make a multiplayer game nowadays, when most of people play free to play games or some rather popular online titles and totally ignore the lest known out. So, is this game worth anything? I guess it is. It's probably the best multiplayer game with dinosaurs. I mean, it's fun to play team deathmatch where one team is full of people and other one is made of dinos. It's rather active, not like more popular online games, but still have some playerbase so you can be sure there is always someone to play it together. Maps are fun, game is rather balanced. What's also important, it does have drop system like in CS:GO - which means, you can earn yourself a few cents while playing, or finding yourself a nice skin for your dinos or humans. Items don't make you any more powerful, those are just cosmetic stuff which is good thing. Also, there are new patches still coming out, so you don't get an abandoned game.\nIf you want to play something other than MOBA games or online shooters with good" vs "bad" guys you should at least try Primal Carnage: Extinction. You can't miss it if you are fan of dinosaurs!"

reviewText:
Hello Steam Community!

Well, I finally have enough hours to write a complete and truthful list of concerns for Primal Carnage: Extinction. While I like this game, it has some major issues that should be understood before anyone buys it. I will, then, endeavor to point out some of these issues. Please remember, I am no expert on games or media. I am an aspiring engineering student with a good vocabulary. These are only opinions, and are in no shape or form certain undeniable truths. We are not talking about “a priori” knowledge here. Please allow me to share my opinions, if I may be so bold. :)

Economy:

I feel that this is a major issue for Primal Carnage: Extinction. As of now, there are skins and textures that sell for ridiculous prices upwards of 300 US dollars. While it can be certain that “legendary” economy items are exceedingly rare, they are simply not worth that sum of money. This is even more truthful when one considers the fact that the game itself has very few players online. In a few years, these high-priced visual items will be almost worthless. I assume that many people will wonder why they went to such an extent to obtain them when they could have spent their precious time and capital elsewhere.

Furthermore, these skins do nothing to improve the game. Many individuals on this game associate high-priced skins with experience, status, or skill. The logical flaws in this sort of assumption are too great to even bother covering. I am an extremely good player myself, and not one of my skins exceeds $30 in value. Still, I have been literally ridiculed by other players for my lack of quote, “skinz”.

Despite these various issues, the developers seem all too poised to continue their economy efforts. It can be certain that while they did issue many fixes, they maintained a major focus on skins and economy. In my view, the excessive and illogical pursuit of the economy system has dealt the game a serious blow.

Community:

Let it be known that Primal Carnage: Extinction has a very polarized player base.

There are incredible people on this game. Many are extremely helpful, logical, coherent, understanding, and friendly. There are some truly good administrators on this community that genuinely care about providing a quality experience for their players. (I like to think that I am one of these, but I cannot commend myself for that would be biased.) When a question is raised, they rush to answer and help. When a troublesome person is spotted, they enforce the rules as necessary.

However, some individuals are absolute rubbish. They are rude, arrogant, disrespectful, conniving, and deceitful. I cannot even begin to list all of the scams and devious ploys I have witnessed. The nature of the “economy” -which I have previously talked about- brings out the worst in some people. It is not uncommon to see individuals begging, scamming, and deceiving in order to obtain items. In addition to this, the game seems to be infested with trolls. As an administrator of a server group, I have watched individuals purposefully attack and disrupt a server’s functionality. It appears as if these trolls literally want to be kicked. In their mind, they can effectively destroy a server by injecting themselves into the session and deliberately inciting a virtual riot against officials. The entire process is sad to watch, and really speaks towards the community’s immature and delinquent views.

I have observed many players who are dissatisfied with the fact that there are very few “deathmatch” servers. Their complaints are valid, as there are rarely any competitive community servers. As an administrator, I can verify one reason why this is so. It is nearly impossible to control the rage, frustration, trolling, and delinquency that such game modes attract. It is likely –although I do not claim to hold tangible evidence for this- that administrators find it easier to host manageable games.

To be forthright, this community both inspires and repulses me at the same time.

Gameplay:

The final and most important issue regarding Primal Carnage: Extinction has to do with gameplay.

There are rampant glitches and issues in this game. From dinosaurs to humans, many weapons and classes can become bugged to the point that they can no longer be effectively used. One good example of this is the raptor pounce attack. When a player changes class to anything besides a raptor, they run the risk of losing their pounce attack’s functionality. This is a horrible issue for competitive players who want to attack the enemy using a diverse strategy, because it limits their ability to change into a more suitable class during different situations.

The team balancing in the game is inferior. On any competitive “deathmatch” game, most players monopolize the dinosaur team resulting in unequal matches. This is dreadful for anyone who cares to master both human and dinosaur gameplay, because it makes the human team a bad choice for anyone. When a match does start out with teams that are in the correct proportions, players often switch to whichever team is currently doing well. In most cases, players will abandon the losing team and join the team that seems to be more secure. In truth, the option to “switch team” during a deathmatch" round should be abolished.

Conclusion:

While I like this game and some of its community
date: I feel that individuals should be aware of certain things. I do not profess to know exactly what is wrong with the game. I have simply provided a list of things that
hoursPlayed: trouble the game. I keep an open mind
voteText: and I never attempt to imply that I understand everything about the community. I am only giving you my experiences. On a more positive note
helpfulPercent: I think that game is quite good aside from these flaws. The lighting is spectacular
votesHelpful: and the graphics are very pleasing. I would give it a 6.8/10.\n"

reviewText:
Review is for 1.4.1.

First off this game struggles immensly to balance the dinos against the humans and each time a update is made that makes one side ever so slightly better then the other the community flips out and whins about it. The community can not be pleased.

Pros:
-Fun gameplay that is fast paced and requires you to be aware of your surrounding
-The different classes for dinosaurs provides vastly different gameplay experiences for each one
-The human classes also differ between each other to make it fun to play as each since they are easy to learn
-Some really good maps that benifit both humans and dinos
-The developers are pretty easy to reach and communicate with the fans on a regular basis
-The promise for more features added each month
-Currently 4 different game modes with 2 more being added in the future
-The steam workshop is availble which allows people to make their own maps and skins and potentially have to be put in the game

Cons:
-80% of the servers are freeroam which is mostly people pretending to be dinos or just idling
-People tend to hog the dinos
-Loot prices can be extremly high for a legendary" skin but its not really a negative if your not gonna spend money on them
-Get to the chopper mode is rarely played
-There can be some strange bugs and glitchs every so often
-Only a handful of maps are used in servers with the test map used quite frequently for some reason
-Certain hours of the day there are very few people online

Im sure im forgetting some stuff but overall its a great game that is only getting better since the developers continue to support it."

reviewText: First Person Shooters are not my thing. I like sandbox games more than I do FPS but, there are some I can make an acception for such as Call Of Duty Black Ops 2, Call Of Duty Advanced Warfare, and this amazing game. When I first heard about the first Primal Carnage I thought it was going to be Jurassic Park team deathmatch with badass dinosaurs. So when I created my steam account, I purchased both the 1st and 2nd Primal Carnage and, the first was ok, but the 2nd was AMAZING. The graphics were very beuatiful and the design of the dinosaurs were like the classics but with a new, highly original, twist. The T-rex, Spino, and Acrocanthosaurs, can feel over powered at times but with teamwork from the human team the game can be challenging for both sides. Playing with both teams can be really fun, but the dinosaurs are the best with ariel and terrestrial maneuvering. This is the FPS I play the most, and would recommend this to anyone who likes FPS games and is sick of just regular C.O.D. team deathmatch.

reviewText:
This game is very fun! I love to play on it and I even  joined a fun group (DLG) from the server DLG: Chill and Kill.
It is my favorite server and I recommend checking it out! I really love this game's simplistic yet modern HUD/GUI while playing both the dinosaur or human. I really only play as a dinosaur though. My best and favorite is the Novaraptor. The game itself is stable too. The maps are well made and beautiful but if you glitch out of them there are parts where its not decorated as much. The models are very well detailed and I love the animations too. The keys and controls are very simple as well. However, as a dinosaur, its harder for those who cannot multitask with the keyboard and mouse at the same time, I would guess same with the human (Refering to a friend of mine). But then again it does have controller support so that definitely is another option for the player. Also the humans can get OP if they all stick together, same with the raptors (mostly to my opinion). But overall, I definitely rate this game 5 stars. I love this game and love to see it grow too.

~Diamond

(P.S. This is my first review also)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you loved the first game, you will love this game. It is essentually the same game but with a massive overhual of the maps and some different machanics for the dinosaurs. It looks stunning compared to the old game and some dinosoars now require a little more skill to use.
There are micro-transactions, but they are purely cosmetic, no pay to win here, and they recently made the skins marketable, making them much more accessible to everyone.
With the promise of new dinosaur classes coming to the game I hope this game will continue to be updated as I personally greatly enjoy it and find it an improvement over the old game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nGreat game :) I totally recommend this game to anyone who has a love for dinosaurs. There are many modes to choose from such as, FreeRoam, Dino vs Dino, Team Deathmatch, Role Play, (GTTC) Get to the Chopper, and many more. It's a large vas world with many maps and wonder graphics. Mechanics are great but could use a little improving, but i assume once released to full version this will all be fixed. The game also features a Loot system which allows players to attain items in the game to customize there appearance.  Over all i give this game a 9/10 and i hope to see more from this later on. :)

reviewText:
the game is great! but the down side on this.. alot of people are having a go at the dev team also is because of how RP is literaly taking over a TDM *based* game..  it used to be TDM - watched alot of vids/ect before it was taken over with rp.. its just terrible..

im re-thinking if i should bother to ask for a refund or not.. i wanted a TDM game not a RP..  its sad to be honest.. i was looking forward on getting this.. now im not so sure..

2nd. cringe would be the servers are lacking *refresh server*  you might see a 29/30 TDM you think *ooh more players - joins* and hit tab or w.e to show how many people.. then see 1 person in there.. and yes its you and no one else..  its not just the pvp servers rp,free roam does the same..

3rd. The Change team rotation in mid battle.. *oh no auto ballance* - it only happens on the dinosaur side when the humans is lacking 1 person..  e.g  - 5 humans - 6 dinosaurs - *auto ballance kicks in*  6 humans 5 dinosaurs - *logic*

everything else is fine, the graphics,gameplay.. but those are my 3 main cringes and hope to god the dev team would fix them.. this game is literaly fun..  But im not saying you should not buy this, if you played the 1st game and liked it.. hell get this one.. just dont think all the servers will be pvp - 8/10 are rp/free roam :p

my recommend is 70 for a yes, 30 for a no.

But im not saying you should not buy this, if you played the 1st game and liked it.. hell get this one.. just dont think all the servers will be pvp - 8/10 are rp/free roam :p

my recommend is 70 for a yes, 30 for a no.

reviewText:
Goddammit, what can I say about this game that hasn't already been said? For ♥♥♥♥ sakes, this game is not a game anymore. It's a total waste of $19.99, or the regional equivalent. I've been holding off on making a review of this game primarilly because I share the opinions of most people who were veterans of the first game, and for the fact that I had made a review of the first game explaining a bit why the original game was much more worth the asking price, but I never went into true detail about just how bad this game has become, but the bottom line is this;

Do. Not. Pay. For. This. Game. In it's current state, it is quite possibly one of the best game concepts I've ever seen turn sour so quickly. If you want a real Dinosaur VS Human shooter, go buy the first game. While it may have animations that are less smooth and slightly dated graphics, it is much better than this pile of filth. So, let me go into detail about the worst aspects of the game, and maybe outline what is wrong and how it can be fixed. As much I dislike this game as it currently stands, I still do have hope that the devs might just get their ♥♥♥♥ together and fix this broken gem so as to bring us a better game. Regardless, let's just dive right in.

Issue #1 - Roleplay/Freeroam Servers

Okay, this little gem is arguably the first or second worst smegma that has come upon the Primal Carnage community. It started in the original Primal Carnage, and it has just never stop. It has essentially snow balled into an enormous pimple on the ♥♥♥ of the Primal Carnage community. The game sells you an image of a shooter with a rather unique concept behind it on the steam page, but when you actually play the game, MAYBE one out of twenty servers is in fact a TDM/GTTC server. In the original Primal Carnage, it started with Dr. MPQC's Roleplay server. Now, I don't blame him for starting this entire plague of RP, but I'm not sure he knew what his server would spawn. From the few conversations I've had with MPQC, he isn't a bad guy. He still currently operates an RP server in PC:E, and it'd be ALMOST insignificant if so many others hadn't followed in his foot steps by making their own RP servers to the point where it's just everywhere. These servers are just plain disgusting to have spawned out of a competitive shooter, but I digress. It's not hard to imagine these servers spawning in the first place when you look back on it, seeing as how Primal Carnage was one of the more prominent games that actually allowed you to play as Dinosaurs, so, naturally, many Dinosaur fans, unlike myself and most others who actually bought the game, prefered to play a Tyrannosaurus just walking aimlessly around the map roaring at other dinosaurs rather than tanking in a TDM server, as there really was no dinosaur game before that allowed you to do such a thing, but regardless, it's nearly impossible to stop now, even with other games like The Isle surfacing on steam with a similar concept with a hardcore survival game twist to it.

Possible Solution

I don't expect any of the community to make changes, as the RPers out number the players who bought the game for it's intended use ten fold. I don't expect the problem to stop at this point, it is simply just to big, but there are ways that it could be, say, made into a game of itself specifically designed for the Weeaboos/Furries that frequent the servers. The only possible solution at this point would be the devs stepping in. Part of the reason that the Freeroam" game mode even exists in PC:E is because of how much roleplay servers erupted in the original Primal Carnage. At the very least
date: they could remove the Freeroam gamemode and shut down RP servers. At the most
recommended: they could make a second open world RP based game that quenches the RPers thirst so as to keep the two player bases separate. Just a thought. Basically nothing can be done at this point
hoursPlayed: even my suggestions I just typed probably won't work in the long run
voteText:
but it's worth a shot.

Issue #2 - Balancing

Even if you DO manage to find a server that you can join and isn't an RP server
helpfulPercent: you still need to look out for one more obstacle. Dino hogs. Unlike the old Primal Carnage
votesHelpful: which wouldn't let you join the Dinosaur team if the Human team had too little players
votesTotal: Primal Carnage does nothing of the sort. The only balancing mechanic is the occasional auto-balance
votesFunny: which randomly switches players around the teams. However
commentsCount: you're able to just leave and re join as a Dinosaur even after the auto-balance. It's completely insignificant as a mechanic. The worst of the Dino hogs are the Tyrant hogs
column16: which are basically kids who use no other Dinosaur but the Tyrants
column17: and even then
column18:
they can't play for ♥♥♥♥. It's sad AND annoying.

Possible Solution

Again
column19:
this is a problem that only the devs can fix. The balancing mechanics of the last game need to be included here or else this game will never match the original.

Issue #3 - ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t Steam Market and a Cancerous Community

PC:E intregrates a new trading system similar to the systems in DOTA 2 and CS:GO. While some of the skins look cool
column20: it leads to dumb ♥♥♥♥ kids flaunting a rare or legendary skin that they got from a crate from one of the six keys their parents would buy them. The community of PC:E is filled with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s and trolls. In Primal Carnage
column21: the only skins that existed were part of DLC packs that were sold from the steam page
column22: not the steam market. With the new market system
column23: some skins on Primal Carnage go for hundreds of dollars when they come out just because the demand is so high
column24: meaning that the players who wish to sell these skins can name their price. These kinds of skins lead to boasting and even making fun of other players for playing any of the original DLC skins. I myself encountered an eight year old on a TDM server who would not shut the ♥♥♥♥ up that I had chosen the default skin before entering the game. Regardless
column26:
and I don't know how it even got this bad.

Possible Solution

The devs can only fix this problem to a point. They'd make more money anyway if they would just switch back to the system of manufacturing skin packs rather than having an enormous trading system like there is now.

Final Verdict - 2/10
column27: Better graphics and smoother animations than the original don't make up for the enormous problems that this game is riddled with. The original is a much better choice and much more worth the asking price."

reviewText:
Buy this game, but unless you really like Dinosaurs, and First Person Shooters, or have a lot of money to spare, wait for a sale. After content update 1, this section will probably be removed.

While before I said this game was buggy and unbalanced (although still recommended it), Patch 0.9EA fixed the game, and was backed up by patch 1.0.0. It's now brilliant. Soon, we get Acrocanthosaurus, AI, and new weapons. But let's not judge the game on what it will be.

This game, in its current state, is better than ever before. The original game's current state is nothing in comparison. While a couple of classes have issues, it's a fun, balanced experience. While this game is very similar to the original, it is more balanced, and has an extra amount of content, with more coming.

A problem is, that a lot of the negative reviews give out lies, but are still said to be helpful" here's the truth:

reviewText:
Primal carnage:Extinction is a great game, IN MY OPINION. even though there is alot of bugs and stuff i feel it is great for people who like dinosaurs.


but let me get this out first, the community is obsessed and overeacting about skins. some skins are on sale for 200$ Really!? The comminuty needs to be focused on gameplay and not just some look for your raptor.

First, lets talk about the team deathmatch. in my opinion, its very unfair to both sides. The tyrants (Rex, Spino, and Acro) NEED to be nerfed or be limited to one at a time, they have insanely high health and are almost impossible to kill when there is healing for the dinos.

The thing about humans, OH ITS UNFAIR ALRIGHT! The people on the human team usually camp with friends near health and ammo boxes, it really gets on my nerves when i'm a raptor and i keep getting killed because i cant get to a corner in tine.

I honestly think that team deathmatch needs to be improved greatly, but it is the core of the series and it is amazing for what it is now.

Second, lets talk about free roam. I absolutely see no purpose for this mode, you just walk around and look at stuff. i hate free roam, it has no purpose.

Third, Get to the chopper. I feel that this gamemode would be amazing! if the community actually game the gamemode attention. it has potential but nobody plays it so my opinion of this mode is that it gets no attention even though it is really great for a gamemode.

Fourth and finally, Roleplay. DISCLAIMER, i love roleplay so i might give this mode a little bit more love than the others)

Roleplay servers have amazing people but it gets too much hate. I honestly think if you like having dinos talk to eachother, than this is your mode.

I dont know why it gets too much hate, it is fun to do if you are bored and want dinos to do their own thing as if you were a dino. the people on the roleplay servers are AMAZING and really kind, they let you join their rp most of the time and are just plain awesome.

I think the game needs alot of fixing but if you exclude that, it can be a great game depending on what kind of person you are. it isnt as great as the original. i honestly love the game and the rp world of it. TDM is fun to play as it is the core of the series.

THIS IS MY OPINION.

reviewText:
I played the first one and really really liked it. Primal Carnage Extincion however is not really like the first one.
The gameplay is incredibly unbalanced, while everyone tries to pick Dinosaur in the beginning of a round you're stuck with always playing Human, which wouldn't be as bad if human wouldn't be incredibly hard to play. Dinosaurs are clearly more powerful and all the balance that you could feel in Primal Carnage doesn't seem to be there anymore.

Sure, if you know how to play human right, you can get a lot of kills, but dinosaurs don't require this learning period that humans do.

One thing that also bothers me is that the Teamswitch at the end of the round like in Primal Carnage doesn't exist anymore. It just switches to the next map which leads you back to the click Dinosaur as fast as possible"
During everyone wanting to play dinosaur you'll also get autobalance quite often and have teams of 9 Dinos and 7 humans.

Knowing how to play the game makes up for a lot of stuff

reviewText:
I absolutlely adore dinosaurs, and this game has arguably the best looking, and best animated ones I have seen in a game thus far..., but I still cant recommend it to anyone looking for more than just good looking dinosaurs.

Sadly, in terms of gameplay it feels weaker than the original. The large dinosaurs are more like sitting ducks, and the raptor pounce is much more clunky to use. The humans' move speed is frankly much too high, in the original, being caught alone as a human meant certain doom, but now any human can 1v1 a trex if they just strafe in circles.

Even after a year of early access, the game still has crippling bugs. More than once I have been spawned under the map. Large dinosaurs frequrently get completely stuck on objects, and Ive even had a few hard crashes.

Hopefully these issues can be ironed out in the coming weeks, but at the time of writing this review, I cannot recommend  this to anyone who isnt a major dinosaur lover.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The original Primal Carnage was a great game and it still plays fairly well, if you put aside the crashes, network issues and other glitches that we've all gotten used to. I'm glad we were finally able to move on and revamp the game from scratch.

Having been on the Beta QA team for the last 5 months, I've seen PC:E evolve from a hilarious playground of bugs into something that's starting to feel as fast-paced and competitive as the original. And with a team of experienced and hard-working developers on the case, things are looking very bright for 2015.

Finally, a word out to all those immature kiddies on the forums who made us laugh and cry with their impatience, conspiracy theories, and downright terrible attitudes. You'll be permabanned, but we won't forget you! Feel free to downvote this review - we know who you are and we don't care.

reviewText:
Due to wanting to create a more in depth review of the game without being limited by the character limit of the steam review writer, I've created a lengthy document to hopefully express my opinions regarding Extinction and its state. So if you want my honest and lengthy opinion please check out the document https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jpjFqwBNRJrJIZn6Jptcv3sMz-fSp_wbIWChqIm6L9U/edit?usp=sharing

Abridged version

Visuals, Models, Animations and Level DesignPretty game with detailed models and interesting level design, however lacking any newer content and mostly recycles assets from the first game with little innovation invested.

GameplayGameplay is straight forward and to the point just as the first game however can feel worse in various areas.

Archosaurs feel worse in terms of movement, weight, and attacks in comparison to the first game but is the most enjoyable section of the game

Humans are more underwhelming than ever with very little weight or impact in their guns and players will get quickly bored of their repetitive and imbalanced game play.

The game's performance can be solid at points however game play is bugged with stuttering issues in mid-combat, health stations not working, bugged sounds, animations, soundtrack, and spawning issues.

GameModesGame comes with four total game modes

Death Match-most commonly played
Get to the Chopper-least commonly played but can be very entertaining
Free roam (Role play)-3D dino chat for kids
Survival- Cod Zombies but with dinosaurs and more dumb AI than Orion Prelude

MarketThe most innovation placed into the game however is flawed with its recycling and recoloring of older skins from the first game.

VerdictLacking in terms of actual new content, the constant use of recycling old assets, and bugged and imbalanced game play. Extinction disappoints me more than it impresses. The most I can recommend for this is to wait for it to go on sale for less than $10.

Once again this is my more abridged version of my review, I go much more in depth with the game in my document so please check that out for more pointers and fair statements regarding the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't let the bad reviews from former QA staff block you from this game. This game's development has been long and troubled and has switched teams entirely. Those who worked with the old team have much to resent about their experiences, but PC:E is a fresh start in every sense of the term. It is a long labored-on work of passion to make up for past shortcomings and it has every potential to succeed.

This review is bein written the day after early access has gone live.  Early access = bugs and lots of them. That's fine. That's what early access is for. Once they're ironed out, this is a game I've reccommended all of my friends to play, because this is the absolute pinnacle of dinosuar vs. human mayhem and it will only get better from here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright, this game... I'm really not sure where to begin, but how about I start with the bugs. Not too bad, especially considering its in early access, nothing paritcularly game breaking or anything. How about the game itself? Well, it is extremely hard for me to find a game that can entertain me, and this game is one of those that don't entertain me for long periods of time, but thats not why I'm even downvoting it. I'm downvoting it because of the loot system, for the most part. Look at the server list, and you'll see a barren wasteland of empty TDM and GTTC servers except for remote and sparsely populated ones, and then absolutely BOOMING loot servers that are 100% full.
Devs, you know you have a problem when your players care about the loot and not the gameplay. It also doesnt help when it seems half-broken aswell, getting the same sandstorm ptera SIX times in a row and getting no alphas. Not even  one rare after about 20 crates, has happened to someone, who then had to resort to buying them off the steam market in order to get anything half-way decent. Also, Im one of those people who don't have a job quite yet, and the fact that the only way to open crates is to BUY keys. I have to ask my previously mentioned friend for money whenever I get a crate, hanging on to that glimmer of hope that maybe, just maybe, I'll get a good skin. In case you're wondering, I only got one skin, atleast  until my friend had to trade a bunch of extras she had to me, then I got one, maybe 2 others that I already got from her. ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ones of course. I have seen very few if any new players that didn't have the original one, and to be frank, the gameplay is a bit lackluster.
The graphics are pretty good, but honestly who cares about that?  I don't think they should drop the loot system, just... change it in some way that I'm not entirely sure about. Maybe tweak the drop rates and make it so you don't have to buy keys, but instead drop them like crates? That would help with the younger people who dont have any money. Anyways, I just want you to know that I myself had the original game, and got it after hearing about it through youtube, and I just fell in love with the idea. There were times I really enjoyed it, too. But this game just isn't the same. I want the game to succeed, but its not going to at this rate.
Sorry for the rant, this is my first review, but I just felt strongly about this. I loved the original, but the loot system and what seems like almost corporate greed and just the gameplay itself just doesnt do it for me. I wouldn't recommend the game in its current state, especially when all the players care only about getting loot. I hope the devs realize what's happening and take steps in the right direction, get the sequel on its feet, but until then, Browse with caution.

Edited by ~LS~ Spot_ON. Thanks, baby :3

reviewText: I have owned primal carnage, the original game, for almost 2 years now, and when I found out they were giving us a Primal Carnage: Extinction, I was uber excited. Primal Carnage is a fast-paced first-person shooter or action-packed third person offensive game. Basically, it's a deathmatch of dinos and humans. Both teams are equally strong in this game, but most people prefer the dinos, obviously. The difference of the graphics and maps are so stunning compared to the orignal game. I LOVE THIS GAME. Please get it if you are a dino fan. Best game of my 2 years on steam so far.
