reviewText:
I as of now do recommend this game. Not because the game is perfect but because of two things:

1. Future of the game
2. Net Worth (what you're paying and what you get.)

My previous review was completely against the game. As we know reviews can change with time, so here's the game's current status as it's been updated!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Primal Carnage is a classic game with tons of originality. Many consider it the birth place and best place for humans vs dinosaur gameplay triumphing over Dino D-Day. Now, there are two versions of this game.

1. Classic ol Primal Carnage
2. Primal Carnage Extinction

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Classic Primal Carnage arguably is what got the game into buisiness, it is the core that lead up to Primal Carnage Extinction's popularity.

I typed up a 4 page explanation before my browser crashed, so I'll sum it up.Cons first, then pros at the ending of the review:Still Tons of skins,

(occasional) Unprofessional ugly skins

HUGE 2 YEAR FLoFF DRAMA,
(See here parents, as a reviewer I must warn there are confirmed cases of sexual harassment, and a lot of them: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/FLoFF )

The internet isn't always safe! Primal fails to adress the bloody issue for 2 years. During this time growing hatred towards a specific individual has taken place, IT'S MASSIVE. (About 45 and growing extremists) Steam landed him a 15 week ban proving primal is slow to respond.
Good skins cost $400 or more and almost ALL (that are sought out for) are feathered novaraptors,

Developers can have a tenancy for arguing with fan base suggestions.

Promised content has delays
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Widely Agreed Con
Now the PS4 gets all skins free with achievements! (this thread got taken down due to trolls, the thread removing instead of troll banning is netorious. It causes a lack of communication and may be responsible for devs ripping players off before an agreement can be made http://steamcommunity.com/app/321360/discussions/6/490121928350801031/#p1 ).... pc players are literally told Just because ps4 works that way doesn't mean we're not working on our computer version's economy!"

....

People have paid $500 for skins already
recommended:
and now PS4 gets them all free?... doesn't matter if you're "fixing" the current economy (Just making it less-unfair lol) IT IS TOO LATE you've ripped them off.
PRO'S
The game has released a patch which optimized the game to an acceptable level. The game actually is fun and has operating killing servers now! The core mechanics are mostly fixed and teams better balanced. The current fan base is very very pleased with the results.

If you do buy I suggest joining groups like BoBo
hoursPlayed: NRiTH
voteText: DLG

These events are spectacular and really bring the community together.

DLG's Dino fight night (Players play as dinosaurs in a 1 v 1 battle. Takes place in an arena and the winner of the tournement earns player of the week! Or have your team fight rexes as boss fights. All this while being surrounded by raptors

reviewText: I have owned primal carnage, the original game, for almost 2 years now, and when I found out they were giving us a Primal Carnage: Extinction, I was uber excited. Primal Carnage is a fast-paced first-person shooter or action-packed third person offensive game. Basically, it's a deathmatch of dinos and humans. Both teams are equally strong in this game, but most people prefer the dinos, obviously. The difference of the graphics and maps are so stunning compared to the orignal game. I LOVE THIS GAME. Please get it if you are a dino fan. Best game of my 2 years on steam so far.

reviewText: Primal Carnage: Extinction.... where do i begin, This game is basically a shooter game based on dinosaurs vs Humans. And oh boy is it fun, this game really can be quite fun and challenging with different classes on both teams both human and dinosaur, (personally i love being a raptor and slashing the hell out of people). and to add a sense of uniqueness to players there are many different wearable items and character skins to aquire, you get these from drops during a round, either in crates or you get the skin or weapons etc as is during the round. If you're lukcy enough to get a skin as is during a drop then good on ya! :D otherwise you get crates which can give you a number of things. Here's the catch with crates though... you gotta pay real money for keys to open these crates -_- oh joy! not.... especially considering the crates give random things so you may not get what you want even though you payed real money to get it.... ugh. And game wise i've found this was the second release to the original game Primal Carnage, apparently this was supposed to be an update to that game but instead they made it a seperate game and made us players re-pay for a different yet.. no so different version of the same bloody game we already had. WOAH cheeky much devs?! However aside from all that annoying stuff the gameplay itself is pretty decent and i get a satisfactable amount of enjoyment out of it. I think alot of gamers would like this game, however like many online games there are a few trolls or quite plainly rude idiots but we tend to shut them up or ignore them i mean just enjoy the game guys stop ruining it for us actual gamers who want to enjoy ourselves xD. Would i recommend this? well to people who like the idea of shooting dinosaurs or being a dinosaur and attacking people or things around those ideas lol then absolutely, if you are someone who doesn't like paying for little things that probably will cause more money spent on the transaction itself then.... probably no you wouldn't want this game. Oh but you can trade on steam so if you have generous friends then it probably will be easy for you to get the stuff you want. So pretty much all and all absolutely yes i recommend this to other players :D This game is incredibly fun for me and as time goes by it'll get better and better when the devs add more and more gameplay ideas and classes, etc. Lets hope they all won't cost stuff lol, i hope this review has helped interested and intrigued gamers about getting this or learning about the game.

reviewText:
After playing this game on my bad laptop that is not the best with games with high requirements, I came to the fact that this is possibly the best game I've ever played in my life. There are so many negative reviews about this game, and I don't really understand why. I do know the balancing is bad, but I've been a dinosaur more than I was being a human. Being a human is fun too, especially when the T-Rexes, Spinos and Acros try to get you when you are hidden and it is impossible for them to get you. xD This game is addicting and I reccomend it to anyone that likes dinosaur games. Most people complain about lag but I have a laptop that does not meet the minimum requirements and I usually get 40 fps. Tip: If you get not much fps, just search up 'How to get better FPS'. That is what I did and I got from 20 to around 30-40. c; I shall not advertise here about programs that I use to get better FPS so if yer interested, just PM me. Alright. Let's end this.
Pros:
Good graphics.
Easy controls.
So much fun.
Very addicting.
Funny community.
Awesome dinos you can choose.
Cool human classes.
Not that laggy. (For me.)
Cons:
Balancing.
---
I just can't think up of anything else for the bad things about this game!
Anyways, I do reccomend this game.  $19.99? Worth it!

reviewText:
I WILL UPDATE THIS REVIEW AS THE GAME UPDATES.

Where should I begin? Well first off if you are new to Primal Carnage I would definitly recommend this game. The gameplay is enjoyable and It draws an incredible picture of how dinosaurs and humans would fight in an arena. I would warn you though the game is early access and does have its ups and downs such lag (which I have not experienced) and other things usually found in typical early access games.

If you are a dinosaur enthusiast who also likes first person shooters this game will give you quite a bit of satisfaction. While the price is high I will say that the devs are very vocal and do speak to the community on a regular basis. This does not mean that their are patches coming out constantly, but it does mean they listen to the community.

To Summarize:
Pros:
-Was one of the first games that allowed you to play as a dinosaur.
-Decent balance that is contantly being tuned.
-Decent graphics.
-Many maps to choose from.
-Dedicated Servers.
-A loyal community.
-For now at least they are releasing updates and a very steady pace.
-Will be part of the steam community market and will allow cosmetic skin drops.

Cons:
-Some say the game is very laggy, this may be true on lower end machines.
-Some of the controls can seem a bit awkward on the dinosaurs at first.
-Some issues with balance between Dinosaurs and Humans, however I am sure these will be ironed out.

All in all I recommend this game for all to enjoy.

reviewText:
Pros:

This is a great shooter and feels a lot more polished than the original Primal Carnage. The maps have been expanded, new weapons added and the character selection screen improved. There is also more scope for customisation. I have had a lot of fun playing it and all things considered I would recommend it.

Cons:

There is a need for more servers; unless you want to play in no kill/ roleplay mode, there's not much choice, maybe 2 servers that aren't empty.

The tranq rifle is one of two weapons available to the sniper class. It is however banned in most servers. You kind of feel like a kid in a playground being told off when an admin gives you a warning in the chat window. If you do not stop using the weapon you will be kicked from the server. Apparently this is because players have complained of motion sickness after being shot. In a game where the dino players have an advantage over the human players this makes the teams even more unequally matched. You could just as validly claim that the jumping raptors give you motion sickness.

reviewText: Here's my review for this game from my personal point of view. I have no clue on what others may think but... here goes nothing.\n\nFrom my point of view, this game is fairly interesting~ that's if you want to kill but... however, there is a problem... there's not many TDM matches nor DDM matches. It's mainly Freeroam, Freeroam, and more Freeroam. So if you want to try to find a good TDM or DDM Server. Good luck, also... there's a thing called dino hogging and human hogging, in which is quite annoying as the other player cannot have a chance to be a dino/human. From one round to the next, dino/human constantly~ non-stop, sadly. Then you get those players who are fairly quite rude, they'd love to insult people over the stupidest of reasons. Sorry... but it is true. When you try to RP you see those mate beggars, skin beggars, and literally... -mating- RP's. It's natural and all but... seriously, some kiddo's play this game and it's rather not good to teach them -too- early. Think about the generations. q3q Also... there's some people who would love to assume some people are hackers when people who cheat can most likely get VAC banned easily if the system detects something on your computer that gives an unfair advantage. Lots of kiddo's on here... so be safe. Don't expect a surprise if one of them rage at ya'. xD Anyhow... the loot system. Uhh... where to start? Darn! The loot system itself gives really crappy items time to times, but sometimes if you're lucky you'll get a good item that you don't have-- yet. Considering I'm a Server Owner and quite lazy to do more typing in this review. I'd say PC:E is overall good if you wish to chill or release your stress unless an ignorant person comes in... just saying.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you're looking for fun dino vs human gameplay, you will need to look elsewhere. Aside from numerous balance issues, bugs, exploits, and unfinished maps, the game has become nothing more than an economy simulator/fashion show. Most people only play this game to get skins and show them off, or sell them on the marketplace for money. Alone, this is not a bad thing, but that is the ONLY purpose for this game now. Most normal play servers are empty. What you're left with are no kill RP servers, freeroam servers where you can have people who are upset that you're killing each other on it, servers that put limits on elements of gameplay (like no rexes, raptor pounces, etc), and loot servers specifically designed for people to gind for drops. the way the drop system works is that, at the end of a match, everyone has a chance to get somethng. the longer you play, the greater your chances. Problem is, you don't have to play" to get something. You can sit idle on a server for long periods and still have a chance to get something. To top that off
date: there is a persistent bug that prevents some people from getting drops in the first place. In my opinion
recommended: the drops aren't worth the time or money people put into them. the rediculously rare alpha skins are "OK"
hoursPlayed: but everything else is more like an existing skin with different saturation levels. It just screams "lazy" on the developer's part. Aside from skins for the dinos
voteText: you can also get recolored weapons for the humans which you can barely see most of the time. The most common drop appears to be dino/human crates. To open these you have to buy keys from the game's store. The amount you pay varies on your region and currency
helpfulPercent: but still feel too expensive. Worst part is
votesHelpful: it's all a gamble. You will more than likely get duplicates of a common skin before you get anything remotely interesting. People have reported spending upwards to $200 on keys only to not have a single rare drop. I do not recommend this game. Maybe things will change
votesTotal: but I highly doubt it."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As a fan of the Original Primal Carnage, it really saddens me that this game is terrible.

Pros
-Dinosaurs still look good
-humans are sort of balanced
-maps and graphics look pretty

Cons
-Gameplay is WAY too fast. Matches are over in few minutes.
-glitches are roaming free. Saw a man embedded in the map, a raptor pounced, both went under the map and died
-crashes are frequent
-no melee for the humans. if a dino is in close quaters, you're finished
-large dinosaurs scale large walls with relative ease
-the commando, a black character, has white arms and hands when viewed in the first person

Please. Avoid this game.

Hi, It's BlackWolf,
I'll be talking about the Gameplay, Graphics and the Dinosaurs along with a few Human updates. I think this is a great game to review on and I hope you find this informative and somewhat helpfull, but please comment on if this gave you the info you wanted.

~Gameplay~

This game has a good gameplay, along with it's new features from the last game Primal Carange"
but if you don't have a "game good" computer I'd suggest putting the graphics quite low. This game has a new pounce option
recommended: Now you can spit with the dilo without roaring
hoursPlayed:
and so on. Which is quite cool. I really liked these new updates.

~Graphics~

This game has realistic and beautiful graphics. Although this sometimes will lag your game out so I mostly have mine on low wile I'm on a "Kill server" Or just regular playing the game. You can take the most amazing screenshots with this game. But! I've noticed that there is a slight problem with the missing textures when you put the graphics up high it does the purple and white textures which is somewhat annoying wile I am screening

reviewText: I bought this mainly for the single player, since my internet connection isn't fast enough to play online and, based on other reviews, I'm not sure if it would matter if it was. I've only played for a few minutes and already don't really care for it. It's alright, and I could play it a little here and there when I have nothing better to do, but I'm pretty disappointed by it. The first problem was the graphical issues, which I noticed right away. If you run into a rock or fence, half your body will be inside the rock or through the fence. Then, there's the numerous grammar issues, mostly missing words all over the place, just giving a very unprofessional look to it.\n\nBut the biggest issue I have is that the single player survival mode is only playable as humans. As I said, I bought this primarily for single player, and obviously when you buy a game like this you want to play as a dinosaur, but playing solo I can't be a dino in a dino game! Except, of course, in the lame free range mode, which is boring and pointless. If survival mode was made playable as the dinosaurs and the graphical issues were fixed, I could definitely see this as being entertaining. I could even overlook the lousy (nonexistant?) proofreading (though it would be nice if that was fixed, too). As is, for my intended use, I wasted $7. And I was really hoping I'd enjoy it so I could buy a few more copies at that price as gifts for friends so once I get better internet we could play together. I guess I'll just wait for another sale after the developer hopefully fixes these problems.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This has been a lot of fun for an early release game.
The game is beautiful and the new content has been exciting to explore.
There are expectedly some issues with the game including handling of characters, unbalanced character strengths, the loot system etc. I feel that the pros outweight the cons, and am excited to see it grow and become what it will be. There is so much potential in this game.

They're releasing updates fairly regularly to fix the issues and I have a lot of fun playing. I'd suggest you get this game if you don't already own it.

reviewText:
-EDITED AFTER OFFICIAL RELEASE-

Would give neutral review status, but said button does not exist.

I previously said this game was a slight improvement on Primal Carnage, but now I take that back completely. It's reverted to being just like it use to be on PC, only now it has slightly improved performance (Graphics-wise) and an inventory system.

Only 2 new modes are introducted in the game at present; dino deathmatch (dino vs dino, but it is very buggy) and FreeRoam (no timelimit, no killcount.) Both modes are enjoyable but aren't without their faults; Dino Deathmatch limits the player to using the raptor, ptera, diloph and carno classes since the rex bite and tail whip have little effect and can easily be brought down by a pack of raptors. FreeRoam's only drawback is how boring it can become if nobody is roleplaying or if there is no prey to hunt; a much needed addition to FreeRoam to maximise its potential is bots for prey. I STILL hope this will be added eventually.

The graphics are roughly the same as PC, but are far less taxing on a machine and allow for better performance (we FINALLY got support for 32bit! No more crashing maps because of a bitwar mess!).
Sound hasn't changed; the sub-classes minus the Spinosaurus all reuse their dominant class soundfiles, and on some occasions the sound comepletely vanishes from the game with no logical explination or reason, and a restart is the only solution. (They say it is fixed, but it isn't.)

Next on my list is the item drops; the skins, while a nice twist to drops, are mainly generic recolours of existing skins and some actually remove your camo and make you stick out like a sore thumb in maps. Not at all handy for a stealthy raptor or diloph...but the skins do look nice, they're just not that practical. The skin-system is also a monopoly, with players able to farm" multiple crates and skins using a bot rather than playing themselves
date: and then selling the rarest skins for insane prices. Personally I would rather just buy the skin DLC like in previous PC
recommended: since I don't have the time or motive to farm for the ones I want
hoursPlayed: but I do see the appeal in keeping one skin set and ditching the ones you couldn't care less about.\nSo I don't hate the item-drop system
voteText: it's just the way the prices go insanely out of control
helpfulPercent:
but then that's the players fault and not the developers.

Speaking of players...

The biggest issue with this game is it's community; the roleplaying section of the group is great! The people are friendly
votesHelpful: the games are fun
votesTotal: but sadly this game is actually a FPS/PvP game and does NOT have what is nessecary for an MMORPG like many people want (a dinosaur and human MMO would be great!)\nSo while I do like going on FreeRoam servers for the occasional RP
votesFunny: I also like to go into the basics this game was originally supposed to have; sadly many of these servers are empty or are full of item farmers
commentsCount: children who clearly migrated from TF2 for the loot
column16:
or bots that have wound up on the wrong server to farm for items.
There are also still many issues still not fixed in this game that have been repeatedly addressed by the community.

Old score: 7/10 (It was fun and buggy) My final overall score: 5/10. (Meh.)

+Like the new modes and maps
+Finally can have games with unlimited dinosaurs or no humans at all!
+Still easy to play

reviewText:
I've been playing this game for a while now and I can safely say that my experience with it has had it's ups and downs. I've never gotten to making a review of it before seeing how a lot of the old comments about the game were true --yes, even the negative ones--, but now I feel the need to jot down my opinions.

Primal Carnage: Extinction is a game about an organization of people who found an island filled with prehistoric creatures and have to kill every single one of them. The dinosaurs fight back to get rid of the humans and keep the island by doing whatever they can to fend them off, even if it means working side by side with another species.
You play as either the dinosaur or the human. In some game modes you can fight human vs human or dino vs dino. Now-a-days the most you'll see when you log into the game and look for a server it'll mostly be Free Roam, where you sit there and listen to people roleplay about dinosex.

IfyouthinkI'm♥♥♥♥ingkiddingjustwaitinaserverforabit.

Now lets hear our Pros and Cons on this game!

+Pros
Play as a dino. Not many games do this, but having to play as an animal and literally 'hunt' these humans is really fun, especially if the humans are really good at what they do. You have to always watch your back, just like the other team.

Kill dinosaurs. Yeah, a lot of games have this feature, its a typical hunting game of man vs. beast, but in this one it's a lot more interesting because the beast is being controled by another person, in a team deathmatch!!

Gives you that rush of adrenaline everytime you hear that mother♥♥♥♥in T-rex. Its not just the rex though, its ANY dinosaur. No matter what you'll nearly ♥♥♥♥ yourself when someone out of nowhere blows your raptor face off or chucks you off a ledge before you could even react!

Half of the players are decent. Yeah, nuff said.

Some cool maps.

Nice skins for customization on both teams.

-Cons (oohhh boy)
There is a votekick system. Yeah, it sounds like a good idea to have so you can get rid of the pesky trolls that go around the server when a mod or admin isn't around, but its also been used countless times by butthurt dweebs we can't stand being killed over and over even though they were shooting or eating you. Doesn't sound too bad? Well, what if I told you that the kick system has three strikes? On the third strike, you're gone for good on that server and would have to contact an admin to get you back in. Still think its not bad? Let me also toss in that people who see a votekick pop up, no matter who is kicking who, always vote 'YES'. Why? No one knows! :o So unless a mod is there to save your ♥♥♥ or not enough people vote in the game, you're ganna have to exit the server and join back in so you won't get your strike, thanks to some pissy person and a bunch of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s :D
As a victim to this, take my word for it.

The mods and admins on certain servers. Not saying all of them, but I'm talking about the servers who intentionally kill with god mode on. No one can do anything to stop them from killing players that try to actually play the game or just want to chill. It just gets really annoying and its unfair when people are actively playing only to get killed by someone who isn't.

I'm sick and tired of seeing every server play on the same map.

I'm also sick and tired of t-baggers. ...Seriously, this isn't COD :/

Suiciders. I don't have a problem with this because it just gives the team a lower score if they do, but a warning to people who find this annoying; expect people to suicide for a laugh or to avoid death by the enemy. Its mostly commandos with their gernade launchers, sometimes its just people who stand by a ledge shooting you so you can run toward them... only to watch them jump down...
...like, seriously, what is the point? To me it only makes you look like a ♥♥♥♥♥ xD

The Free Roam servers with no tyrant limit. If you're a human and want to kill some dinos while chilling in a Free Roam, there is guarantee that the server would eventually be FILLED with tyrants. This is unfair because there is absolutely no way of surviving even if you have friends on your side. The tyrants are tanks that kill you in one bite (if they catch you), and considering that a wall of mouths is hunting you down, yeah, you're ♥♥♥♥ed.

Now my favorite part of my rant- uh, I mean, opinion!!

The carno nerf. (And until this is fixed, my review is going to include this bull)
Are you the type who likes to hit and run? Or just brutally run over anyone you see like the little ♥♥♥♥♥ that they are? (yeah, how dare they look at you funny, or try to shoot your precious dinosaur skin!) You like things that run sanic fast and can get away from gunfire at the speed of sound?!

Well too ♥♥♥♥ing bad!

Meet the carnotaurus! The most SLOWEST, most USELESS, most EASIEST TO KILL dinosaur in the game! The carnotaurus is a charger class that can't run for ♥♥♥♥ anymore thanks to the devs breaking those magnificent thighs to the point it takes a full year for it to start running where by then it would lose 1/4 of it's stamina, leaving you the rest to get away very slowly.
Carnotaurus used to be one of the best classes in the game because it can get in and out of places in a heartbeat. It was the CHARGER, the one that would always get away or stick around to put a pesky human in it's place.

Before this god forsaken update the Trapper (a class that used nets to trap small dinos and prevent big ones from biting) was the master at catching and instant killing the little dinos. This human class was horribly nerfed to where the trapper is just as useless as the carno. Dinos have a greater chance of escaping nets and tazers now that the instant kill for trappers is gone.
If you think about it... what kind of ♥♥♥♥ing person takes their ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ time killing a raptor who is out to rip their face off? You now have to machette the ♥♥♥♥er until it's dead, and that takes way too much time and a waste of bullets if you chose to shoot it instead. It also takes little time for the raptor to escape the net and run off to heal.

Yeah no ♥♥♥ u game

============================================================

UPDATE :5/1/2016:

The game is still having its ups and downs, most of the pros and cons I've mentioned before are still there, but the good news is they made the trapper and carno how they were before. The trapper can one-shot netted dinos again with the knife and the carno is a beast once more.

But now I have another thing to add about this community just to warn the ones who are sensitive to this kind of behavior...

Recently I've been getting a lot of hate just because I'm able to kill a few butthurt people. They began calling me names in the chat, and I'm pretty sure they were meaning to votekick me after I heard a few votekick 'dings' on a server who disabled votekick. I fear the community is only going to get more toxic from these people who can't play the game for the thrill. They'll start harassing you with foul language and never leave you alone in the server if you make them ♥♥♥♥♥♥. You'll eventually need an admin or mod to help you out and it just gets really ridiculous. Personally I enjoy watching people rage, but for those of you who can be hurt by these comments I recommend being very careful.

Thats all for now. Hopefully things will change. PC:E isn't a bad game at all, but the people here are just a real handful. Disrespectful, angry, and sobbing children is what this game is made up of with the exception of some really awesome people.

You have been warned. :I

reviewText:
I am very iffy about this game, being a fan of the original game I have quite a bit to say about this game, so I'll show you the pros and cons of this game in my opinion.

<PROS>

-Gameplay & Mechanics

The gameplay, in general, has improved, with less bugs/glitches, less balancing issues, and some new introduced mechanics, but do note I said less, it still has a fair share of problems.

-Customization

The customization has improved dramatically with you being able to customize idividual assets for each character, instead of having to select from preset skins.

<CONS>

-Micro Transactions & Loot

The game has a terrible loot system, which you get items way to rarely, and they are way to commonly duplicate loot. The game is already $20 which it isn't even worth that much, it would barely be able to earn a $10 price tag and yet they still shove micro transactions in your face.

-Community & Servers

Extremely disrespectful, and very under aged, have yet to meet one other good sport in the game, and its disgraceful. Also the servers are overloaded with Free Roam games, and almost every single one of them, if you enter them will have a dinosaur orgie or dino sex of some kind, mostly preformed by children under the age of ten, and if they are older they most likely have nothing better to do with their lonely life, then to virtually have sex with tyrannosaurus's under a waterfall.

- Game Isn't Complete

There is way too much missing from this game to call it a full game, it should still be in alpha, maybe even pre-alpha.

IN CONCLUSION

If you want the classic Primal Carnage experience with Deathmatch's, Get to the Chopper, and Capture the Egg then go and get the original. If you want customization, and alot of horny 5 year olds hosting Tyrannosaurus Sex (See what I did there) servers then go with this alpha game falsely titled a non-alpha game. This game has alot of potiential with none of it successfully executed, so therefore I recommend holding off on purchasing this game until more progress is made.

I was at a LAN party this weekend and the organizers were pushing us to download this game, giving away 1 week free passes. I figured that means I should review it.

We had a lot of fun playing this, with up to 20 players at a time. You play as either the a dinosaur, or a human hunter. The T-rex is the most satisfying to play as. You have an amazing amount of health, but walk slowly, and if you can sneak up on a hunter, you can swallow them whole! There are other choices.

The multiplayer system switches your team each game.

Its fun, I will probably buy it.

reviewText:
I wish there was a neutral option for rating this game, but I'll make do with a yes because at the very least it's better than the first. The levels look and feel nicer; old ones have been touched up and honestly the environments are absolutely picturesque compared to the first game.

From what little I've played so far the balance seems a lot better between the two teams. I've played and am relatively alright at both dino and human, so no bias here. Admittedly haven’t played every dino, so I can’t cover them all… but I’ll mention what I have in a moment.

As human I love the new weapon system and the fact you can throw down ammo and health for your teammates. While playing every dinosaur is an adequate threat within reason. I like that ‘tyrants’ only kick you around now instead of instantly killing you by walking on you. I’d much prefer they were taken out of the game entirely but I know that if the devs did that their fans would have a shitfit so I’ll just keep the opinion to myself. They have the terrible ability to ‘vacuum’ people into their mouths, too, which is annoying. But overall they’re a bit easier to take on so that’s good.

As both dino and human I have a teeny issue with carnosaur. It no longer feels like a stealth class which needs to get the drop on people in order to achieve kills, which was what I enjoyed about it in the first game. Not sure completely what it is… but I’m not the only one who doesn’t feel quite right about it. It seems a lot harder to dodge even when you see it coming right at you. And a lot less fun to play.

Raptor is perfect. Once you get the hang of steering with a mouse it’s a dream to play, and with the slower speed I actually have a chance of shooting it as a human. So long as my opponent hasn’t done what I previously mentioned, anyway.

Haven’t played enough of the spitter classes to know much about them, but the one that shoots acid seems a little too slow for how big and conspicuous it is.

The drop system disappointed me with the fact it only drops crates… but hey what can ya do. Maybe they’ll actually make it useful later on.

Overall it’s much funner than the first game to me and its nice not having someone hacking and ruining the fun for everyone every other time I decide to play. Gameplay seems more balanced, though it’s certainly not perfect. Not sure if it ever will be with the nature of the game, but it’s still better than the first.

reviewText:
I want to like this game, I really do, but it's just not there yet.
(Positive): The new skins and customization are great, a lot like TF2, and they'll probably rake in a ton of money with this idea.  (This could've easily been added to the original though)  Some of the skins however, seem really shiny giving them a faker plastic look.
(Draw): The map are essentially the same they just added more vines here and there. (again something they could've simple added to the original).
(Negative): Gameplay. I would've thought they'd have fixed some of the big loopholes that were in the original game (killing a tyrant while circling in its blind spot) sadly these are even more pronounced. The controls are slow to respond and they feel heavy.
(Negative): Most people seem to understand this game was a money grab and as such there are fewer people that play it.
Overall, it's disappointing.  If you did a side by side comparison of this game and its predecessor" they both look essentially the same but the original plays better and actually seems more well balanced team-wise. When other new games come out (like with COD for example) there's usually enough new material to merit  them being their own freestanding game
date: I can't say that for this game.  It seems like a lot of time and effort were wasted creating a new game around material that would've been better suited as a patch or DLC.  If you want to spent a lot of money buying keys to unlock crates that may or may not have something good in them or just straight up dropping a ton of money to get the fancy skin you want then yea you'll enjoy this game.  If you want to blow up some dinosaurs up or eat some fleeing humans just get the original.\nI will continue to periodically play this game in the hope that future patches change my mind on it."

reviewText: This game is the sequel to the original game with the same concept named, well, Primal Carnage. This game was meant to be a free update, although it has been released as a new game due to copyright issues with developers switching. That being said, this game is now a lot better than Primal Carnage and many future updates are planned, so this game doesnt look like it is going to be abandoned. The game improves the core gameplay of the original carnage by polishing it and trying to make it more polished and refined. The dinosaurs are a bit clunky, but the devs have announced they are working on those problems, so thats nice. This game is definitely worth $20 for the sheer amount of fun you will get from it. Although i dont play this game religiously, i do like to play it every once in a while, and the hours stack up. The dinosaurs feel a bit more awkward and clunky than the first Primal Carnage but overall the game is more refined and finished than the other.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First thing to know before you play this game, always watch the skies, chances are you are about to get abducted.

If you have played the original primal carnage then you know what to expect, for those who don't, primal carnage is a class based multiplayer shooter with one team being human and the other team are dinosaurs. The game is fun for the most part, but there are some severe balancing issues, for one don't expect to win while playing the human side, usually the human side will be outnumbered sometimes as much as 2 to 1, but the game is still pretty fun to play.

reviewText:
I recommend it for the sake of it being being a good time with Good friends and regular improving. Do I recommend buying it at 20$? No, but if you had the discount(was 3 dollars) or a sale(under 10 dollars) comes up it is worth your money. Just to be able to ♥♥♥♥ around with nice scenery and have fun with friends. There are major things wrong and as a former QA member of C5 I just don't see it getting much better.

Most of the community can be pretty decent. The main vice of the community is poor sportsmanship ( whether by abusing the OP classes/skills or just by a majority of them only playing one side which hampers those that play both sides evenly), short attention spans ( leading to market prices being crazy) and by far the worst thing I have seen is that very few understand the concept of seeding or playing on a low popular server. The last part leads to to very empty TDM servers and the oh so smart TDM players attacking those that rpers about it instead of actually doing something about it and honestly the server situation is only getting worse.

Balance is close to good right now, but after this latest patch I loose hope that it will ever feel as good as 1.2 Primal Carnage and earlier. The game is getting attention paid to it by the devs and devs to respond to the community responses on balance. Which leads to mixed results and the new tyrant was shoehorned into the game in a way that made the other classes a much poorer choice to make. Subclasses should not work like this in any game.

Working game mods include TDM, freeroam(score doesn't matter, infinite time on a map, no team balance, and mostly used for roleplay), GTTC <get to the chopper only a few servers with this one (it's less popular) and the newest game mode Survival . A WIP gamemode of Dino vs Dino is availible but there are a few bugs with it, pretty fun regardless. Once DVD and Hunt come out I feel might be worth 15 bucks because of the teasers we've gotten for those game modes, but the core gameplay is still missing something to be really enjoyable in most game modes. A poorly implimented In Character(vicinity limited) chat and Out Of Character(server wide) talk have ruined roleplay because it is completely opposite with how normal chat travels. Like how do you mess that up?

Loot drops are only skin related so all the crazyness about them is unnessary in my opinion. Yet there are still bots, dedicated traders and loot whiners about. The market is really unstable because of how expensive the newest fad skin can get and how fast older skins drop in price.

This game has potential. It always has but it seems to be a forever in the wrong hands to polish this great idea and base.

reviewText:
Before you read the review please note the amount of time listed, so the review is most likely going to be a little biased but I couldn't play the game any longer because it was so bad and boring you'd have to pay me to carry on playing this, all I'm doing is warning you about wasting money on this game when the first one was so much better.

Here's an overview of the good things about this game:
-The graphics are OK. Nothing really special here but not too bad either, unless you're talking about the large dinosaurs that manage to clip through the buildings and kill you
-The sound is quite good, one of the few good things about this game, especially the T-Rex roar, reminded me of the original Jurassic Park
-Quite a few maps and servers, though most of the servers seem to be full of people roleplaying and having dinosaur sex? If you don't believe me look it up for yourself, it's weird.
-Some new maps, though nothing enough to make you buy this over the first
-Interesting concepts being used, though probably a bit too advanced for whoever had the misforutune of making this game

Bad things:
-The raptor spam is unbelievable, they have a stupid ability to pounce on you and pin you to the ground, the only way to get out of this is if someone helps you by shooting it. The result of this is most people camping in one spot because heading out on your own into the forest or anywhere else to experience the game like it was meant to be played results in you being pinned to the ground and killed, you can't even mash a button on the keyboard to get out and have a chance. The same applies to the pterodactyl which can carry you into the air, though it's not as overpowered as the raptor spam as it's easier for players to spot and shoot it's wings. However you should be able to get out of it's grasp by mashing a key on the keyboard which gets progressively easier the higher it gets.
-The maps are buggy, large dinosaurs have somehow developed phasing technology to eat you from the outside of buildings, this hasn't happened often but it has happened before.
-The trappers ability to fire a net at the dinosaurs can be unbelievably annoying and buggy, for instance I fired a net at a bloody pouncing raptor (Yes, I know) which should have incapacitated it on the floor, instead it didn't stop and still managed to claw me to death, even though it was wrapped tightly in a net. You might say it's momentum made it carry on, sure, but that doesn't mean it can still claw me to death if normally it makes it stop on the floor for about 10 seconds.
-Nothing groundbreaking was added that wasn't in the previous one
-I already mentioned roleplaying, as many other reviews here have, what idiot thought it would be a good idea for T-Rex's and pterodactyls to have children together? If you try to join a normal server you might have dificullity doing that too as I did on several occassions, and then you realise that over half the servers on here consist of roleplay ones.
-Community is really not that great compared to the first game
-Human classes are quite genereic
-Dinosaurs due to being extremely unbalanced will generally win every game or at least all the games I played.
-Maps overall tend to favour the dinosaurs, though this issue isn't as bad as the rest
-Skins can be extremely overpriced, who cares if you bought one for $300? I don't, just played the damned game.
-Economy? lol
-Hoard mode is really repetitive.

Overall as you've probably read maybe it's just because I don't have as much time on the game as some of the pros we see on the server, ranting about how good it is. Then again, judging by the other reviews it really is just a bad game that really doesn't live up the expectations of the first one.

TL;DR - The game is buggy and broken, most servers consist of weird dinosaur roleplay with a bunch of 12 year olds and the community is rubbish. Play the original if you want a good dinosaur game, do not waste money on this garbage.
